info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 19 at 5:34AM CDT until August 19 at 10:30AM CDT by NWS Chicago IL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following county, Kendall.
* WHEN...Until 1030 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may be out of their banks. Low-lying areas such as fields and ditches may remain flooded. Some roadways may be flooded, as well.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 530 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicate that between 2 and 4 inches of rain fell across the county on Monday evening. It will likely take additional time for flood waters to fully recede. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oswego, Yorkville, Minooka, Plano, Sandwich, Montgomery, Boulder Hill, Newark, Millington, Millbrook, Lisbon, Plattville, Bristol, Little Rock, far southern Aurora, far western Joliet, and far western Plainfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM CDT THIS MORNING
